text: The Royal Danish Navy ranks follows the NATO system of ranks and insignia, as does the rest of the Danish Defence. Outside this ranking system there are physicians (who may wear the same insignia in the Army/Air Force but with a slight variation in the Navy), nurses and veterinarians, while priests and judicial personnel wear totally different insignia and are without rank. ==Current ranks== Besides the NATO-system, the Danish defence utilizes its own system, which for the navy is as follows: * Military personnel, level 400 (M400): Executive level: OF-5 though OF-9 * Military personnel, level 300 (M300): Operational level: OF-1 through OF-4 * Military personnel, level 200 (M200): NCO level: OR-5 through OR-9 * Military personnel, level 100 (M100): Seamen level: OR-1 through OR-4 ===Officers=== The highest officer's rank is OF-9 (Admiral) which is reserved for the Chief of Defence (only when this seat is occupied by a naval officer). The Prince Consort of Denmark held the rank of Admiral (à la suite). Similarly, OF-8 (Vice-admiral) is reserved for the Vice Chief of Defence). OF-7 (Kontreadmiral) is used by the Chief of the Royal Danish Navy and OF-6 (Flotilleadmiral) by the chief of Danish Task Group as well as keepers of high-office positions. OF-4 and OF-5 are mainly chiefs of squadrons, schools and larger vessels. OF-1 through OF-3 are used in a variety of positions. {| style="border:1px solid #8888aa; background-color:#f7f8ff; padding:5px; font-size:95%; margin: 0px 12px 12px 0px;" |- style="background- color:#CCCCCC; width: 100%" ! Danish Pay Grade !! colspan=2 | !! colspan=2 | M406 !! colspan=2 | M405 !! colspan=2 | M404 !! colspan=2 | M403 !! colspan=2 | M402 !! colspan=2 | M401 !! colspan=2 | M332 M331 M322 !! colspan=2 | M321 !! colspan=3 | M312 !! colspan=3 | M311 !! colspan=6 | M310 !! colspan=6 | |} Furthermore, officers of between the ranks of OF-9 and OF-6, have their own standards. File:Naval Rank Flag of Denmark - Admiral.svg|Admiralsflag File:Naval Rank Flag of Denmark - Vice Admiral.svg|Viceadmiralsflag File:Naval Rank Flag of Denmark - Rear Admiral.svg|Kontreadmiralsflag File:Naval Rank Flag of Denmark - Flotilla Admiral.svg|Flotilleadmiralsflag File:Naval Rank Flag of Denmark - Chief of Squadron.svg|Eskadrechefsstander ===Enlisted=== The Danish OR's also follow the NATO system, though there are no OR-6's. OR-4 (Korporal) is the highest of the M100-level ranks is and not considered a NCO-rank. {| style="border:1px solid #8888aa; background-color:#f7f8ff; padding:5px; font-size:95%; margin: 0px 12px 12px 0px;" |- style="background-color:#CCCCCC; width: 100%" !Danish Pay Grade||colspan=6|M232 ||colspan=2|M231 ||colspan=2|M221 ||colspan=6| ||colspan=3|M212 ||colspan=3|M211 ||colspan=4|M113 ||colspan=10|M112 |} File:Danish Navy rank insignia for seniormekaniker.svg|Seniormekaniker (Senior leading Mechanic) File:Danish Navy rank insignia for overmekaniker af 1. grad.svg|Overmekaniker af 1. grad (Leading Mechanic 1st class) File:Danish Navy rank insignia for overmekaniker af 2. grad.svg|Overmekaniker af 2. grad (Leading Mechanic 2nd class) File:Danish Navy rank insignia for mekaniker.svg|Mekaniker (Mechanic) File:Rank insignia of marinekonstabelelev of the Royal Danish Navy.svg|Marinekonstabel uden tjenstegren (Marinekonstabel with no branch of service) File:Rank insignia of Værnepligtige of the Royal Danish Navy.svg|Marineelev (Seaman recruit) The Branch of Service logos are placed in the middle of the ranks, to signify the service. RDN gunner service badge.svg|Våben, Artilleri (Gunner) |Våben, Mine (Gunner, mines) RDN torpedo service badge.svg|Våben, Torpedo (Torpedo) RDN communication service badge.svg|Kommunikation (Communication) |Kampinformation (Action information) |Administration (Supplies and secretariat) |Elektronik (Electronics) |Informatik (Informatics) |Automatik (Automatic) |Maskine (Engineering) |Sanitet (Medical) |Proviant/Forplejning (Stores) |Militærpoliti (Military Police) ===Clerical personnel=== Denmark-Navy-Dean.svg|Naval Dean Denmark-Navy-Chaplain.svg|Naval Chaplain ==Historical ranks== The sleeve insignia was first introduced in the Royal Navy in 1871 and was based around the British Royal Navy. In order to become more standard, the admiral ranks were changed in 1951. ===Timeline of changes=== {| style="border:1px solid #8888aa; background-color:#f7f8ff; padding:5px; font-size:95%; margin:
